body_html:
Looks like the problem is that the system() library function is flaky. Here's what happens:

  • we use system() to check if we can compile with the fusion compiler on CPU
  • If system() fails due to flakiness (maybe fork didn't run due to there not being enough memory?) the graph fuser does not fuse the graph, resulting in a graph without the FusionGroup.
  • Now the expect test always expects there to be a FusionGroup so it errors out.

edit: I confirmed that the system() library function is failing with ENOMEM

we use system() to check if we can compile with the fusion compiler on CPU
If system() fails due to flakiness (maybe fork didn't run due to there not being enough memory?) the graph fuser does not fuse the graph, resulting in a graph without the FusionGroup.
Now the expect test always expects there to be a FusionGroup so it errors out.

edit: I confirmed that the system() library function is failing with ENOMEM
body:
Looks like the problem is that the `system()` library function is flaky. Here's what happens:
- we use `system()` to check if we can compile with the fusion compiler on CPU
- If `system()` fails due to flakiness (maybe `fork` didn't run due to there not being enough memory?) the graph fuser does not fuse the graph, resulting in a graph without the FusionGroup.
- Now the expect test always expects there to be a FusionGroup so it errors out.


edit: I confirmed that the system() library function is failing with ENOMEM
